author: {'steamid': '76561198282532232', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1490348999}
review:
Edit in 2018: This review sucks, don't read it.

- No body customization. The cars look like that from the start.
- Upgrades are only decent at best. The game gives you the ability to change the exhaust, pistons and add turbos. That's pretty much it for engines. Not kidding, only those three.
- Not much in the way of settings. For graphics, you can only choose between Low, Med and High. There's also no option for Audio and further controls customization.

[b]Important:[/b]

- [u]You are literally penalized for just playing the game.[/u] The game has a system where you have to pay for engine wear, tyre wear, and fuel. They all go down when you drive the car at all. No, not  when you crash; when you DRIVE. You have to pay for these individually. My minimal pay for drifting is even more subtracted now. The heck am I supposed to buy anything at all?

Maybe this is normal in other games? I only fancy games where I am not limited in something like this. Honestly, the first person who thought penalizing your players for playing your game the way it's supposed to was a good idea should have their loved ones beaten. (Because they are probably equally as douchey.) If the developers wanted realism, work on the physics first.

- [u]Wheel users can go jump off a cliff.[/u] The game countersteers the car for you when drifting in a game ABOUT drifting. There is no option to turn this off. There is also no FFB, at all. So yay.

I'm a wheel user. If I wanted the game to take control of my steering and assuming I'm a GTR fanboy who doesn't actually know how to drift, Christ, I can go to NFS 2015 for that.



If you have a good computer and are looking for a game with nice drifting physics and lots of upgrades and tuning, get Forza you madman. At least on that game the developers doesn't hate you and give the chance to earn money.
If you're looking for realism get Assetto Corsa. (But you're reading this so you're probably aren't.)

Positives? I can't really think of any that isn't already done better by another game. Drifting is okay? Graphics look very nice? Again, if you want pretty pictures get Forza.
developer_response:
Thank you for this Review!
I appreciate it! 
All the things will be fixed/added in the future updates!
Hope you will like the game later!
Have a nice day!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987337838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1490364779}
review:
It's a bit rough and ready but it's super fun. You can get really nerdy with changing loads of suspention settings. I managed to totally ruin my car by putting a massive turbo on it and then ruining the suspention settings. Which was both informative and funny. Hopefully I can learn to fix it. You can even remap your ECU that i'm scared to do but it seems like it will be fun to seee if the engine will actually explode. The game is so detailed that it probably will! 
It's also really relaxing when you get the hang of it and glide effortlessly round a corner or two. It's a great drifting game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102978506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1490344659}
review:
---PROS---

The game it self is fun and the customisation is big with lots of content.
The online component is made very well and I experienced very little lag on it


---CONS---

There are some bugs like constant music changing automatically while driving.
And falling off maps.
Game feels choppy on an up to date pc.
Devs have stated that the game will be updated.
Game isn't in early access which most likely means the game will rarely be updated.
If the Devs do update this game and fix the issues I'll update my review and maybe recommend the game.

EDIT: Google Play ( Android ) has this game on it. [FOR FREE]
Link: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.AUTORUS.ProjectJDM&hl=en

author: {'steamid': '76561197987833947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1490321320}
review:
Played this game for a bit. Its really good! But the biggest thing is my controller freaked out just like it did in Drift Street Japan... And I fell through the map a couple times. But the game just came out so I cant talk to bad about it. If they keep it updated I say this will be a popular game. For the price might as well try it out! BUT if controller doesnt get fixed then the game will suck.

Im planning on playing around with controller settings to see if that will fix it.

**I also did what they said when setting up controller. Didnt work still sits and revs and hot brakes itself.**

Link to video below! I managed to hit every pole in the game!
